questions.statement: Choose the correct sentence:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
En el presente simple, para la tercera persona singular (She), se debe usar el auxiliar negativo "doesn't" seguido del verbo en forma base ("like", sin la 's').
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Estructuras Negativas
**Componente:** Present Simple
---

questions.statement:
Complete the sentence:
"My brother ______ soccer every Saturday."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué A es correcta?**
"My brother" equivale a "He" (tercera persona singular). En oraciones afirmativas, se agrega **-s** al verbo.
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Tercera Persona
**Componente:** Present Simple
---

questions.statement:
Choose the correct form of the verb "To Be":
"They ______ doctors."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El verbo "To Be" se conjuga como "are" para el sujeto "They". (I am, He/She/It is, We/You/They are).
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Verbo To Be
**Componente:** Present Simple
---

questions.statement: Choose the correct question:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
Para "She", el auxiliar correcto es **Does**. El verbo principal debe ir en forma base ("live").
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Estructura Interrogativa
**Componente:** Present Simple
---

questions.statement:
Select the correct position for the adverb "always":
"She ______ late for class."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué A es correcta?**
Los adverbios de frecuencia (always, never, usually) van **después** del verbo To Be. (She **is** always late).
*Nota: Van **antes** de otros verbos (She **always** eats).* Wait, let me check the option.
Option A: "is always". Correct usage: "She **is always** late."
Option B: "always is". Incorrect.
My generated option A text says "is always". My explanation says A is correct.
Let me double check the selection.
Wait, option A selection is [ ]. It should be [x].
Correction on the fly:
A) is always [x]
B) always is [ ]
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Adverbios de Frecuencia
**Componente:** Present Simple
---

questions.statement: Choose the grammatically correct sentence involving a Wh- question:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
Estructura: Wh-Word + Auxiliar (Do/Does) + Sujeto + Verbo Base?
Sujeto "Your parents" es plural ("They"), así que usa el auxiliar **Do**. El verbo debe ser **live**.
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Wh- Questions
**Componente:** Present Simple
---

questions.statement:
Identify the error in this sentence:
"I am understanding the lesson now."

options.text: Stative verbs like 'understand' are rarely used in continuous forms. Should be "I understand".
'Now' cannot be used with present tense.

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué A es correcta?**
Verbos de estado mental (understand, know, believe, like) son **Stative Verbs** y generalmente no se usan en tiempos continuos (-ing), incluso si ocurren "ahora". La forma correcta es el Present Simple: "I understand".
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Stative Verbs
**Componente:** Present Simple vs Continuous
---

questions.statement: Select the correct form: "If I ___ rich, I would travel the world."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
En el segundo condicional, se prefiere gramaticalmente usar "were" en lugar de "was" para todas las personas (subjuntivo), indicando que la situación es hipotética o irreal.
**Competencia evaluada:** Comunicación en lengua extranjera
**Componente:** Grammar - Second Conditional (To Be)
---

questions.statement:
Complete the sentence structure:
"If she _______ time, she would help you."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
La estructura del segundo condicional requiere el **Pasado Simple** (Simple Past) en la cláusula del "If". El pasado de "have" es "had".
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Formas Verbales
**Componente:** Second Conditional
---

questions.statement:
Complete the result clause:
"If I lived in Paris, I _______ visit the Eiffel Tower."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
La cláusula de resultado en el segundo condicional usa **would** + verbo base. "Will" se usa para el primer condicional (situaciones reales/probables).
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Auxiliares Modales
**Componente:** Second Conditional
---

questions.statement: Choose the sentence that gives advice using the "If I were you" structure:

options.text: If I am you, I study more.
If I was you, I study more.
If I were you, I would study more.
If I be you, I studied more.

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
La expresión fija para dar consejos es "If I were you, I would...". Es una aplicación clásica del segundo condicional.
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Uso Comunicativo (Advice)
**Componente:** Second Conditional
---

questions.statement: Which sentence describes an imaginary situation essentially impossible to happen now?

options.text: If it rains, I will stay home.
If I have time, I call you.
If I had wings, I would fly.
If she comes, we will go.

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
Tener alas ("had wings") es una situación irreal/imposible para un humano. Por eso se usa el segundo condicional. Las opciones A, B y D son primer condicional (situaciones posibles).
**Competencia evaluada:** Pragmática - Contexto de Uso
**Componente:** Conditionals (First vs Second)
---

questions.statement: "If he ________ the answer, he would tell us." (Negative form)
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué D es correcta?**
La negación en el Pasado Simple (requerido en la cláusula If) se forma con **didn't** + verbo base ("didn't know").
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Formas Negativas
**Componente:** Second Conditional
---

questions.statement:
Identify the formal variation using Inversion (Omission of 'If'):
"If I were rich, I would help the poor."

options.text: Was I rich, I would help the poor.
Were I rich, I would help the poor.
If were I rich, I would help the poor.
Had I rich, I would help the poor.

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
En contextos formales y literarios, se puede omitir "If" invirtiendo el sujeto y el verbo "were". "Were I rich..." equivale a "If I were rich...".
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Estructuras Avanzadas
**Componente:** Second Conditional - Inversion
---

questions.statement: What is the main concern expressed in the text?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
El texto enfoca sus consecuencias principales en el derretimiento del hielo polar y el consecuente aumento del nivel del mar ("sea levels could rise"), advirtiendo sobre el riesgo de inundaciones ("flooding") para ciudades costeras.
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Crítica - Identificación de Ideas Clave
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: According to the text, what is melting at unprecedented rates?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
El texto dice explícitamente: "Global warming is causing **polar ice** to melt...".
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: Which energy sources are suggested as a solution?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El texto sugiere cambiar a energías renovables: "renewable energy sources like **solar and wind power**".
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: Based on the text, what is the primary cause of the phenomenon described?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El texto establece la relación causal: "driven by the **emission of greenhouse gases**". Las otras opciones son consecuencias o síntomas, no la causa principal.
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Inferencial - Causa y Efecto
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: The word "**unprecedented**" in the text means:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
En contexto, "unprecedented rates" indica que la velocidad de derretimiento es algo que nunca antes había ocurrido ("without precedent").
**Competencia evaluada:** Léxico en Contexto
**Componente:** Vocabulary
---

questions.statement: It can be inferred from the text that if we do not switch to renewable energy:

options.text: Coastal cities might eventually disappear or be damaged.
Measuring sea levels will become impossible.

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El texto advierte que si esto continúa ("if this continues"), el nivel del mar subirá y las ciudades costeras enfrentarán inundaciones. Inferimos que no actuar (no cambiar de energía) llevará a daños severos o pérdida de estas ciudades.
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Inferencial - Predicción
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: What is the author's primary tone in this text?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
El autor usa palabras como "risk", "crucial", "unprecedented" y advierte sobre peligros futuros, lo que denota un tono de urgencia y advertencia sobre una amenaza.
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Crítica - Intención del Autor
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: What does Maria do after school?

options.text: She does homework and plays with friends

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El texto indica la secuencia temporal: "**After school**, she goes home, does her homework, and plays soccer...".
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal - Identificación de Secuencia
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: At what time does Maria wake up?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué D es correcta?**
El texto comienza diciendo explícitamente: "Maria wakes up at **6:00 a.m.**".
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal - Detalles Específicos
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: How does Maria get to school?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El texto dice: "then she **walks** to school".
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: What does Maria do immediately *before* walking to school?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
La secuencia es: "She has a big breakfast..., **then** she walks to school". Por lo tanto, desayunar es la acción inmediatamente anterior a caminar.
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal - Secuencia
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: Based on the text, why does Maria walk to school?

options.text: Because the school is near her house.

questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El texto da la razón (causa): "she walks to school **because it is near her house**".
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Literal - Causa y Efecto
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: It can be inferred from the text that Maria is:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
Aunque no dice "Maria is a student", el texto menciona que va a la escuela ("school"), tiene clases ("Classes start"), y hace tareas ("homework"). Esto permite inferir que es una estudiante.
**Competencia evaluada:** Lectura Inferencial
**Componente:** Reading Comprehension
---

questions.statement: In the sentence "She has a big breakfast with **her** family", the word "**her**" refers to:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué A es correcta?**
El pronombre posesivo "her" se refiere al sujeto de la oración y del texto, que es Maria. Significa "la familia de Maria".
**Competencia evaluada:** Referencia Pronominal
**Componente:** Grammar in Context
---

questions.statement: What is the opposite of "expensive"?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
"Cheap" (barato) es el antónimo directo de "expensive" (costoso), refiriéndose a un precio bajo.
**Competencia evaluada:** Léxico - Antónimos
**Componente:** Vocabulary
---

questions.statement: Which word means "Very small"?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
El texto define: "**Tiny** (Very small)".
**Competencia evaluada:** Léxico - Definiciones
**Componente:** Vocabulary
---

questions.statement: The library is a place to study, so everyone must be:
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
Por contexto, una biblioteca requiere silencio. "Quiet" (silencioso) es la cualidad adecuada, y es el opuesto de "Noisy".
**Competencia evaluada:** Léxico en Contexto
**Componente:** Vocabulary
---

questions.statement: A Ferrari costs a lot of money. It is an ______ car.
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué A es correcta?**
Si algo "costs a lot of money" (cuesta mucho dinero), el adjetivo correcto es "expensive".
**Competencia evaluada:** Léxico en Contexto - Sinónimos/Definición
**Componente:** Vocabulary
---

questions.statement:
Complete with the comparative form:
"A bicycle is ______ than a car."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué C es correcta?**
El comparativo de adjetivos cortos ("cheap") se forma agregando **-er**. "Cheaper than" significa "más barato que".
**Competencia evaluada:** Gramática - Comparativos
**Componente:** Vocabulary/Grammar
---

questions.statement: Which of the following pairings is INCORRECT?
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué D es correcta?**
Wait. Let me re-read "Which pairing is INCORRECT?".
Options A (Antonyms), B (Antonyms), C (Antonyms - Costly is syn to Expensive, so Costly-Cheap is Antonym pair).
Option D: Noisy - Loud. These are **Synonyms**, not Antonyms. The other pairs (if C is interpreted as Antonym) are opposites.
Let's clarify C: Costly vs Cheap. Costly = Expensive. So Costly vs Cheap is an Antonym pair.
So A, B, C are Antonyms.
D (Noisy - Loud) are Synonyms.
So if the pattern is "Find the pair that is NOT an antonym pair", D is the odd one out.
Or simply, "Which pairing involves synonyms instead of opposites?".
Let's adjust the question to be clearer. "Which pair contains synonyms?" No, "Noisy - Quiet" was the text example.
I will change D to "Noisy - Quiet" to be correct, and C to "Costly - Expensive" as the target if I want synonyms.
Let's stick to the prompt "Which pairing is INCORRECT based on the text's logic of Opposites?".
Text logic: X <-> Y (Opposites).
A: Safe - Dangerous (Correct Opposites).
B: Huge - Tiny (Correct Opposites).
C: Costly - Cheap (Correct Opposites).
D: Noisy - Loud (Synonyms).
So D is the one that breaks the "Opposite" logic.
Explanation: "Noisy" y "Loud" son sinónimos, no antónimos. El antónimo de Noisy es Quiet.
**Competencia evaluada:** Relaciones Semánticas
**Componente:** Vocabulary - Synonyms vs Antonyms
---

questions.statement: "The view from the mountain was magnificent; the city looked ______ from up there."
questions.explanation:
**¿Por qué B es correcta?**
Desde una gran altura ("from up there"), las cosas se ven muy pequeñas. "Tiny" es la palabra adecuada para describir esta perspectiva visual.
**Competencia evaluada:** Léxico en Contexto (Avanzado)
**Componente:** Vocabulary
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"PLEASE DO NOT FEED THE ANIMALS"**
questions.explanation:
**Zoo (Zoológico):** Es el lugar donde se exhiben animales y se prohíbe alimentarlos por su salud.
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"SILENCE, EXAM IN PROGRESS"**
questions.explanation:
**School (Escuela):** Es el lugar típico donde se realizan exámenes y se requiere silencio absoluto.
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"DANGER: DO NOT SWIM HERE - SHARKS"**
questions.explanation:
**Beach (Playa):** Los tiburones (sharks) viven en el mar, por lo que este aviso se encontraría en una playa.
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"PLEASE CLEAN YOUR TABLE AFTER EATING"**
questions.explanation:
**Fast food restaurant:** Es común pedir a los clientes que limpien su mesa después de comer.
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"FLIGHT 702 TO MIAMI IS DELAYED"**
questions.explanation:
**Airport (Aeropuerto):** Los "flights" (vuelos) ocurren en aeropuertos.
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"SALE: BUY ONE GET ONE FREE"**
questions.explanation:
**Shop (Tienda):** Las ofertas (Sales) son típicas de tiendas comerciales.
---

questions.statement:
Where can you see this notice?
**"PLEASE TURN OFF YOUR CELL PHONES"**
questions.explanation: **Cinema (Cine):** Se pide apagar celulares para no molestar durante la película.

questions.statement: **"You use this to cut paper or cloth."**
questions.explanation:
**Scissors (Tijeras):** Herramienta diseñada para cortar (cut) materiales delgados.
---

questions.statement: **"This is a place where you can buy medicine."**
questions.explanation:
**Drugstore/Pharmacy:** Lugar específico para la venta de medicinas.
---

questions.statement: **"This animal is very large, grey, and has a long nose called a trunk."**
questions.explanation:
**Elephant:** El único animal con trompa (trunk) y de color gris y gran tamaño en la lista.
---

questions.statement: **"You wear these on your feet to do sports."**
questions.explanation:
**Sneakers/Trainers:** Calzado deportivo. Gloves son manos, Hat cabeza, Scarf cuello.
---

questions.statement: **"This person flies an airplane."**
questions.explanation:
**Pilot:** Profesional encargado de pilotar aviones.
---

questions.statement: **"You use this object to write with ink."**
questions.explanation:
**Pen (Bolígrafo/Pluma):** Se usa para escribir con tinta (ink). Pencil usa grafito, Eraser borra, Sharpener afila.
---

questions.statement: **"This is a yellow fruit that monkeys love."**
questions.explanation: **Banana:** Fruta amarilla alargada asociada típicamente con los monos.

questions.statement:
Person A: **"I have a terrible headache."**
Person B: **"__________"**

options.text: You should go to the party.
You should take an aspirin and rest.

questions.explanation:
**Opción B:** Es la única respuesta lógica y empática ante un dolor de cabeza (sugerir medicina/descanso).
---

questions.statement:
Person A: **"Can you pass me the salt, please?"**
Person B: **"__________"**
questions.explanation:
**Opción C:** "Here you are" (Aquí tienes) es la respuesta estándar al pasar un objeto solicitado.
---

questions.statement:
Person A: **"What time does the movie start?"**
Person B: **"__________"**
questions.explanation:
**Opción B:** Responde directamente a la pregunta "What time" (A qué hora).
---

questions.statement:
Person A: **"Nice to meet you."**
Person B: **"__________"**
questions.explanation:
**Opción B:** Es la respuesta de cortesía recíproca al ser presentado a alguien.
---

questions.statement:
Person A: **"Would you like some coffee?"**
Person B: **"__________"**
questions.explanation:
**Opción A:** Acepta el ofrecimiento cortésmente. "Yes, I do" sería para "Do you like...?".
---

questions.statement:
Person A: **"How are you today?"**
Person B: **"__________"**

options.text: I am fine, thanks. And you?

questions.explanation:
**Opción B:** Es la respuesta estándar para saludar y preguntar por el estado de ánimo.
---

questions.statement:
Person A: **"Can I help you?"** (in a store)
Person B: **"__________"**

options.text: Yes, I am looking for a blue shirt.

questions.explanation: **Opción A:** Es una respuesta coherente en el contexto de una tienda ("Estoy buscando una camisa...").
